intro: Calyptridium parryi var. martirense, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has adapted to harsh, dry environments with its succulent leaves and deep root system that helps it conserve water. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
